intro: Dryas ajanensis, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale purple in color. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are covered in fine hairs, helping to retain moisture in cold environments. Dryas ajanensis is well adapted to harsh climatic conditions and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
